alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Martin; Pitt; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:03AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Washington, eastern Pitt, southeastern Martin and northwestern Beaufort Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1203 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Hinson to near Old Ford. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Washington, Plymouth, Pinetown, Hinson, Old Ford, Roper, Long Acre VFD, Jamesville, Smithwick and Dardens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
